perturbation.original_text: 3.3 ACCEPTANCE AND BETA TESTS Within the time periods designated in the SOW, Client shall perform any tests or evaluation of the Subject Program (collectively, the Acceptance Tests) after the Acceptance Test Date, to determine whether each Deliverable: (a) conforms to the SOW; and (b) performs repetitively on an appropriate variety of data and platforms, without failure, as more fully described in the Specifications. Upon completion of II Deliverables, the Acceptance Tests shall be performed on the Subject Program in its entirety in order to determine whether the Subject Program (i) meets the Specifications and (ii) operates with internal consistency.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.3 ACCEPTANCE AND BETA TESTS Within the time periods designated in the SOW, Client shall perform any tests or evaluation of the Subject Program (collectively, the Acceptance Tests) after the Acceptance Test Date, to determine whether each Deliverable conforms to the SOW.
perturbation.explanation: The removal of the clause stating that Deliverables must perform repetitively without failure and that the Subject Program operates with internal consistency weakens the acceptance criteria. This potentially contradicts implied warranty of merchantability under the Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), which Washington State has adopted. By omitting the requirement for consistent and reliable performance, the contract allows for acceptance of software that may not be fit for its intended purpose, violating the UCC's implied warranty.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) - Implied Warranty of Merchantability as adopted by Washington State

perturbation.original_text: 10.3 NON DISPARAGEMENT CLAUSE The Client and the Designer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging comments Online regarding any of the Designer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates. The Client and Designer both agree not to post on defamatory websites or review websites any negative posts concerning each other, the names of our companies, and our employees. Both the Client and the Designer both agree and acknowledge that this non-disparagement provision is a material term of this Agreement, the absence of which would have resulted in the Company refusing to enter into this Agreement. Subject to the terms, conditions, express representations and warranties provided in this Agreement, Designer and Client both agree to indemnify, save and hold armless each other from any and all damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arising out of any finding of fact which is inconsistent with Designer's representations and warranties made herein, except in the event any such claims, damages, liabilities, costs, losses or expenses arise directly as a result of gross negligence or misconduct of Client.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.3 NON DISPARAGEMENT CLAUSE The Client and the Designer both agree to never to disparage or speak ill of the other party to anyone and or post negative or disparaging comments Online regarding any of the Designer's products, services, affiliates, subsidiaries, officers, directors, employees or shareholders, and will take reasonable steps to prevent and will not knowingly permit any of their respective employees or agents to, disparage or speak ill of such persons. For purposes of this Section, "disparage" shall mean any negative statement whether written or oral, about Seattle Software Developers, Inc., Dot Com LLC. and or any of its affiliates. The Client and Designer both agree not to post on defamatory websites or review websites any negative posts concerning each other, the names of our companies, and our employees. Both the Client and the Designer both agree and acknowledge that this non-disparagement provision is a material term of this Agreement, the absence of which would have resulted in the Company refusing to enter into this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the indemnification clause in the non-disparagement section, the contract fails to provide a remedy for breaches of the non-disparagement agreement. While non-disparagement clauses are generally enforceable, omitting any recourse for a party harmed by disparagement creates an imbalance and could be seen as unenforceable or against public policy, especially in jurisdictions with strong consumer protection laws. It also puts the client at greater risk should they disparage the developer. This creates a legal risk.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding enforceability and fairness; potential conflict with consumer protection laws if interpreted as unduly restricting criticism.

perturbation.original_text: 12.1 CHOICE OF LAW AND VENUE This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Washington without regards for its conflict of laws principle. The Parties will conduct friendly negotiations to resolve any dispute arising from this Agreement, including mediation if requested by either Party. Should mediation fail, each party consents to the personal jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in King County, Washington. If there is a dispute between the Parties relating to this Agreement, the Party substantially prevailing will be entitled to recover all costs and expenses of any subsequent proceeding (including trial, appellate, and arbitration proceedings), including reasonable attorneys' fees and costs incurred therein.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.1 CHOICE OF LAW AND VENUE This Agreement will be governed by the laws of the State of Washington without regards for its conflict of laws principle. The Parties will conduct friendly negotiations to resolve any dispute arising from this Agreement, including mediation if requested by either Party. Should mediation fail, each party consents to the personal jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in King County, Washington.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause specifying that the substantially prevailing party in a dispute will be entitled to recover costs and attorneys' fees, the contract deviates from standard practice and may violate legal principles promoting access to justice. In many jurisdictions, including Washington, courts consider the ability to recover attorneys' fees when assessing the fairness and enforceability of contract provisions, particularly in consumer contracts. Removing this clause could be seen as deterring legitimate claims, particularly smaller ones, because the potential cost of litigation could outweigh the benefits, creating an imbalance and violating public policy principles of equal access to justice.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Public policy principles related to access to justice; potential violation of consumer protection laws if interpreted as deterring legitimate claims.
